oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Intra-farm communication about calf health: who's talking?
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Moore, D. A.
Sischo, W. M.
Davis, M. A.
Vanegas, J.
Pereira, R.
Warnick, L.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: communication
animal health
veterinarians
management
implementation
drug-use decisions
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Effective communication within an organization is essential for accomplishing tasks and for job performance and satisfaction. The dairy business is not an exception to this rule, especially as it applies to animal health and the many people responsible for animal care. Because dairy veterinarians work with the consolidating US dairy industry, their understanding of the many layers of management on these larger farms and the communication realities within them are critical to effective implementation of health-care decisions. Of particular concern are drug-use decisions at the calf level.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2013; 189-190
